de.brands4friends.daleq.core

Class Daleq

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.brands4friends.daleq.core.Daleq

  • public final class Daleq
extends java.lang.Object
    Daleq's Embedded DSL.

    The static methods in this class are the foundation of Daleq's embedded DSL.They are intended for static import 

    import static de.brands4friends.daleq.core.Daleq.*;

    and then to be used as 

    final Table products = aTable(ProductTable.class).with(
 aRow(PRODUCT_1).f(PRICE, "1.00"),
 aRow(PRODUCT_10).f(PRICE, "10.00"),
 aRow(PRODUCT_9_99).f(PRICE, "9.99"),
 aRow(PRODUCT_50).f(PRICE, "50.00")
 );

    • Method Detail

      • aTable

        public static <T> Table aTable(java.lang.Class<T> fromClass)
        Builds a Table of the type defined by fromClass.

        Daleq needs to know about a table's meta model. One option to define a meta model is Daleq's class based table definition approach, as done with TableDef. This method builds a table which assumes that fromClass holds such a meta model.

        Parameters:
        fromClass - a class annotated with TableDef that defines a class based table definition.
        Returns:
        a Table which is ready to receive some rows.
        See Also:
        TableDef, Table

      • aRow

        public static Row aRow(long id)
        Builds a Row with the given id.

        Parameters:
        id - the Row's id, as defined by Row.
        Returns:
        a Row, which should ultimately be added to a Table.
        See Also:
        Row

      • fd

        public static FieldDef fd(DataType dataType)
        Defines a Field in the class based table definition approach.
        Parameters:
        dataType - the field's dataType.
        Returns:
        a Field Definition
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if dataType is null.
